pageProps.pageTitle: Toggle timer - Enterprise Data Federation Service (EDFS) | iTwin Platform

initialApis.name: edfs
initialApis.description:
Enterprise Data Federation Service (EDFS or EDF) is a set of iTwin integration services designed to enable integration of Bentley iTwin platform solutions with any external enterprise system or user solutions (such as SAP®, IBM® Maximo™, Microsoft® SharePoint, ESRI, etc.). EDFS is the latest generation (6th) of BECS integration engine.
EDFS is designed to support any requested integration by running any EDFS integration package from Bentley Integration Catalogue (BIC). Thanks to this flexibility and zero coding needed for design or maintenance of integration packages is easy to adapt any integration request.
Main mission of EDFS is to provide zero coding, ready to use, Bentley catalogue based integration gateway to any user enterprise system or solution.

api.name: edfs
api.description:
Enterprise Data Federation Service (EDFS or EDF) is a set of iTwin integration services designed to enable integration of Bentley iTwin platform solutions with any external enterprise system or user solutions (such as SAP®, IBM® Maximo™, Microsoft® SharePoint, ESRI, etc.). EDFS is the latest generation (6th) of BECS integration engine.
EDFS is designed to support any requested integration by running any EDFS integration package from Bentley Integration Catalogue (BIC). Thanks to this flexibility and zero coding needed for design or maintenance of integration packages is easy to adapt any integration request.
Main mission of EDFS is to provide zero coding, ready to use, Bentley catalogue based integration gateway to any user enterprise system or solution.

items.name: packages-uniqueName-itwins-iTwinId-odata
items.description:
---

Get OData entity sets for the integration package.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must have the EDFS `Execute Integration Package` role assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin.
Package role assignments can be set
- By [setting integration package roles](/apis/edfs/operations/packages-roles-assignments-add/)

---

templateParameters.name: uniqueName
templateParameters.description: The unique name of integration package

parameters.name: uniqueName
parameters.description: The unique name of integration package

responses.description: OK

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

representations.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<edmx:Edmx Version="4.0" xmlns:edmx="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edmx">
        <edmx:DataServices>
            <Schema Namespace="ns" xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm">
                <EntityType Name="OPTEST_Equipments_Read">
                    <Key>
                        <PropertyRef Name="EQUNR" />
                    </Key>
                    <Property Name="EQUNR" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="EQTYP" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="EQART" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="INVNR" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="GROES" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="BRGEW" Type="Edm.Decimal" Scale="Variable" />
                    <Property Name="GEWEI" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="ANSDT" Type="Edm.Date" />
                    <Property Name="ANSWT" Type="Edm.Decimal" Scale="Variable" />
                    <Property Name="WAERS" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="GWLDT" Type="Edm.Date" />
                    <Property Name="HERST" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="HERLD" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="SERGE" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="TYPBZ" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="BAUJJ" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="BAUMM" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="OBJNR" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="IWERK" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="EQKTX" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="TPLNR" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="ABCKZ" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="SWERK" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="GSBER" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="KOKRS" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="BUKRS" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <Property Name="RUN_GUID" Type="Edm.String" />
                    <NavigationProperty Name="OPTEST_Equipments_Read" Type="ns.OPTEST_Equipments_Read" Nullable="false" />
                </EntityType>
                <EntityContainer Name="container">
                    <EntitySet Name="OPTEST_Equipments_Read" EntityType="ns.OPTEST_Equipments_Read">
                        <NavigationPropertyBinding Path="OPTEST_Equipments_Read" Target="OPTEST_Equipments_Read" />
                    </EntitySet>
                </EntityContainer>
            </Schema>
        </edmx:DataServices>
</edmx:Edmx>

items.name: packages-uniqueName-itwins-iTwinId-odata-entitySet
items.displayName: Get the data for the entity set
items.description:
---

Retrieve Entity Collections or Individual Entity by ID. To retrieve Entity Collections use `/entitySet`. To retrieve Individual Entity by ID use `/entitySet(key)`.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must have the EDFS `Execute Integration Package` role assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin.
Package role assignments can be set
- By [setting integration package roles](/apis/edfs/operations/packages-roles-assignments-add/)

---

items.name: execute-post
items.description:
---

Execute the specified integration package for the specified iTwin. Other integration package specific variables can be provided in the body.

To get an example of input for each integration package you can retrieve the details
- By [getting details of subscribed integration package](/apis/edfs/operations/subscribed-packages-details-get/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must have the EDFS `Execute Integration Package` role assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin.
Package role assignments can be set
- By [setting integration package roles](/apis/edfs/operations/packages-roles-assignments-add/)

---

items.name: subscribed-packages-details-get
items.description:
---

Retrieve details of the currently subscribed integration package by organization.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must have the `edfs_projmng` permission assigned at the Organizational level or be an Organization Administrator.

---

items.name: packages-roles-assignments-add
items.displayName: Add package role to iTwin project role assignments
items.description:
---

Adds new integration package role to iTwin project role assignments for the integration package.

You can retrieve the available packageRoleIds
- By [getting integration package roles](/apis/edfs/operations/packages-roles-get/)

You can retrieve the available iTwinRoleIds for your iTwin project
- By [getting iTwin roles](/apis/access-control-v2/operations/get-iTwin-roles/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given Project or have `administration_manage_roles` permission assigned at the Project level.

An Organization Administrator must have at least one of the following roles assigned in User Management: Account Administrator, Co-Administrator, or CONNECT Services Administrator. For more information about User Management please visit our Bentley Communities [Licensing, Cloud, and Web Services](https://bentleysystems.service-now.com/community?id=kb_article_view&sys_kb_id=1e5410491b7d8a90f3fc5287624bcb57) wiki page.

User must also have the following permission assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin:
- `edfs_ilsmng` to Manage Access to specific Integration Packages
	
Each integration package role has its own permission(s) assigned and the user who wants to manage them must have these permissions assigned as well.

__Package roles and associated permissions__
- Execute Integration Package
	- `edfs_objipexec` to Execute Integration Package(s)

---

templateParameters.description: The unique name of integration package

parameters.description: The unique name of integration package

items.name: packages-roles-get
items.description:
---

Retrieve information about the currently available integration package roles assignable to iTwin roles for the integration package.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given Project or have `administration_manage_roles` permission assigned at the Project level.

An Organization Administrator must have at least one of the following roles assigned in User Management: Account Administrator, Co-Administrator, or CONNECT Services Administrator. For more information about User Management please visit our Bentley Communities [Licensing, Cloud, and Web Services](https://bentleysystems.service-now.com/community?id=kb_article_view&sys_kb_id=1e5410491b7d8a90f3fc5287624bcb57) wiki page.

User must also have the following permission assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin:
- `edfs_ilsmng` to Manage Access to specific Integration Packages

---

items.name: packages-roles-assignments-patch
items.displayName: Patch package role to iTwin project role assignments
items.description:
---

Patch existing integration package role to iTwin project role to assignments for the integration package.

You can retrieve the available packageRoleIds
- By [getting integration package roles](/apis/edfs/operations/packages-roles-get/)

You can retrieve the available iTwinRoleIds for your iTwin project
- By [getting iTwin roles](/apis/access-control-v2/operations/get-iTwin-roles/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given Project or have `administration_manage_roles` permission assigned at the Project level.

An Organization Administrator must have at least one of the following roles assigned in User Management: Account Administrator, Co-Administrator, or CONNECT Services Administrator. For more information about User Management please visit our Bentley Communities [Licensing, Cloud, and Web Services](https://bentleysystems.service-now.com/community?id=kb_article_view&sys_kb_id=1e5410491b7d8a90f3fc5287624bcb57) wiki page.

User must also have the following permission assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin:
- `edfs_ilsmng` to Manage Access to specific Integration Packages
	
Each integration package role has its own permission(s) assigned and the user who wants to manage them must have these permissions assigned as well.

__Package roles and associated permissions__
- Execute Integration Package
	- `edfs_objipexec` to Execute Integration Package(s)

---

User must be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given Project or have `administration_manage_roles` permission assigned at the Project level.

An Organization Administrator must have at least one of the following roles assigned in User Management: Account Administrator, Co-Administrator, or CONNECT Services Administrator. For more information about User Management please visit our Bentley Communities [Licensing, Cloud, and Web Services](https://bentleysystems.service-now.com/community?id=kb_article_view&sys_kb_id=1e5410491b7d8a90f3fc5287624bcb57) wiki page.

User must also have these permissions assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin.
- `edfs_ilsmng` to Manage Access to specific Integration Packages
	
Each integration package role has its own permission(s) assigned and the user who wants to manage them must have these permissions assigned as well.

__Package roles and associated permissions__
- Execute Integration Package
	- `edfs_objipexec` to Execute Integration Package(s)

---

items.name: credentials-set-post
items.description:
---

Create external system information and its credentials set.

You need to provide the `SystemId` (unique within the integration package) and the `SystemType`. You can retrieve them
- By [getting integration package system types](/apis/edfs/operations/system-types-get/)

You also need to provide the `credentials`. These are system properties (different for each system type). You can retrieve them
- By [getting integration package system type properties](/apis/edfs/operations/system-type-properties-get/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must have the `edfs_credmng` permission assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin.

items.name: timer-post
items.description:
---

Insert integration package timer.

You need to provide the `packageUniqueName` which is the uniqueName of the integration package the Organization that owns a given iTwin is subscribed to.
You need to provide the `cronStr` that represents the cron expression (a cron expression is a string consisting of six or seven subexpressions/fields that define a schedule). The integration package will be executed according to this schedule.
You need to provide the `parameters`. Parameters are input variables for the integration package. To get an example of the input for each integration package you can retrieve the details
- By [getting details of subscribed integration package](/apis/edfs/operations/subscribed-packages-details-get/)

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

### Authorization

User must have the `edfs_listmng` permission assigned at the iTwin level or be an Organization Administrator for the Organization that owns a given iTwin.

---
